public ref class RoutedEventConverter sealed : System::ComponentModel::TypeConverter

Docs.summary: Converts a object from a string.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Markup.RoutedEventConverter> class only converts an instance of <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEvent> from a <xref:System.String>.

Docs.param: A format context that provides information about the environment from which this converter is being invoked.
Docs.summary: Attempts to convert the specified object to a object, using the specified context.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Markup.RoutedEventConverter> class only converts from <xref:System.String>. Various techniques are employed in an attempt to obtain a result. `typeDescriptorContext` is checked for various services including <xref:System.Windows.Markup.IXamlTypeResolver>, <xref:System.Xaml.IXamlSchemaContextProvider>, and <xref:System.Xaml.IAmbientProvider>. The provided string is also checked against the internal list of WPF registered routed events on <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement>. If all these attempts fail to resolve, <xref:System.NotSupportedException> is thrown.

Docs.exception: is not a string or cannot be converted.
